storyTitle: As Attendance System Administrator, I want to integrate biometric device data to achieve real-time attendance data aggregation

testCases.title: Validate successful biometric data ingestion
preconditions: Admin user has valid credentials and access to admin dashboard
Biometric device is operational and accessible
Attendance database is available and has sufficient storage
Network connectivity between system and biometric device is stable
Test biometric device API credentials are available

steps.action: Log into the admin dashboard using valid administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard loads successfully and displays configuration options

steps.action: Navigate to biometric device configuration section in admin dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Biometric device configuration page is displayed with input fields for connection settings

steps.action: Enter biometric device connection details including API endpoint, authentication credentials, and polling interval
steps.expectedResult: All configuration fields accept input and display entered values correctly

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Apply' button to save the biometric device connection settings
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed confirming connection settings saved successfully, and settings are persisted in the system

steps.action: Simulate a biometric attendance event by having a test employee scan their biometric credential on the connected device
steps.expectedResult: Biometric device registers the attendance event and makes data available via API

steps.action: Wait for system to retrieve the attendance event data and monitor the data ingestion process
steps.expectedResult: System retrieves event data from biometric device within 1 minute of the event occurrence

steps.action: Query the attendance database to verify the newly ingested attendance record
steps.expectedResult: Attendance record exists in database with correct employee ID, timestamp matching the biometric event time (within acceptable margin), and device identifier

steps.action: Compare the stored data fields with the original biometric event details
steps.expectedResult: All data fields match exactly including employee ID, timestamp, location, and event type (check-in/check-out)

postconditions: Biometric device connection remains active and configured
Test attendance record is stored in the database
System continues to monitor and ingest subsequent biometric events
Admin dashboard reflects successful connection status

testCases.title: Verify retry mechanism on connection failure
preconditions: Biometric device connection is already configured and operational
Admin has access to system logs and monitoring dashboard
System retry mechanism is enabled with configured retry intervals
Ability to control biometric device API availability for testing

steps.action: Access the biometric device API control panel or test environment
steps.expectedResult: API control interface is accessible and shows current API status as active

steps.action: Disable or stop the biometric device API service temporarily to simulate connection failure
steps.expectedResult: Biometric device API becomes unavailable and returns connection errors

steps.action: Wait for the system to attempt its next scheduled data pull from the biometric device
steps.expectedResult: System attempts connection and fails due to unavailable API

steps.action: Access system logs and search for connection failure entries related to biometric device
steps.expectedResult: System logs contain clear connection failure messages with timestamp, device identifier, and error details

steps.action: Monitor system behavior and logs for automatic retry attempts
steps.expectedResult: System automatically initiates retry attempts according to configured retry policy without manual intervention

steps.action: Review system logs to verify retry attempts are being logged
steps.expectedResult: Each retry attempt is logged with accurate timestamps, attempt number, and failure reason

steps.action: Re-enable or restart the biometric device API service to restore availability
steps.expectedResult: Biometric device API becomes available and responds to connection requests successfully

steps.action: Monitor system logs and data ingestion status for successful reconnection
steps.expectedResult: System successfully reconnects to biometric device on next retry attempt

steps.action: Verify that system resumes normal data ingestion operations
steps.expectedResult: System resumes pulling attendance data from biometric device and processes new events successfully

steps.action: Check admin dashboard for connection status update
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard shows connection restored and displays successful data ingestion status

postconditions: Biometric device connection is restored and operational
All connection failures and retry attempts are logged in system logs
System resumes normal data ingestion operations
No data loss occurred during the connection failure period

testCases.title: Ensure secure data transmission
preconditions: Biometric device connection is configured and active
Network traffic inspection tools are available (e.g., Wireshark, Fiddler)
Test environment allows network traffic monitoring
Invalid API credentials are available for unauthorized access testing
Admin has access to system audit logs

steps.action: Start network traffic monitoring tool and configure it to capture traffic between the system and biometric device
steps.expectedResult: Network monitoring tool is active and capturing packets on the relevant network interface

steps.action: Trigger a biometric attendance event to initiate data transmission from device to system
steps.expectedResult: Data transmission occurs and network traffic is captured by monitoring tool

steps.action: Analyze captured network packets to inspect the data transmission protocol and encryption
steps.expectedResult: Data is transmitted using secure protocol (HTTPS/TLS) and payload is encrypted, not readable in plain text

steps.action: Verify authentication headers and tokens in the captured traffic
steps.expectedResult: Authentication credentials are present, properly formatted, and transmitted securely (not in plain text)

steps.action: Attempt to access the biometric device API endpoint using invalid or missing authentication credentials
steps.expectedResult: API request is rejected immediately without processing

steps.action: Review the error response returned by the API for unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: API returns proper HTTP 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status code with appropriate error message indicating authentication failure

steps.action: Attempt to access the API using expired authentication tokens
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with proper error message indicating token expiration

steps.action: Navigate to system audit logs section in admin dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs interface is accessible and displays recent access attempts

steps.action: Search audit logs for entries related to the unauthorized access attempts made in previous steps
steps.expectedResult: All unauthorized access attempts are logged with timestamp, source IP, attempted credentials, and failure reason

steps.action: Verify that successful authentication attempts are also logged in audit logs
steps.expectedResult: Successful access attempts are logged with timestamp, authenticated user/service, and action performed

postconditions: Network monitoring tool is stopped and traffic capture is saved for review
All unauthorized access attempts are documented in audit logs
System security remains intact with no unauthorized access granted
Biometric device connection continues to operate securely

storyTitle: As Attendance System Administrator, I want to aggregate manual attendance entries to achieve comprehensive real-time attendance data

testCases.title: Validate ingestion of manual attendance data
preconditions: Admin user has valid credentials and access to manual data upload interface
Sample manual attendance CSV file is prepared with valid data format
Biometric attendance data already exists in the system for comparison
Attendance database is operational and accessible
Admin monitoring interface is available and functional

steps.action: Log into the admin dashboard using valid administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard loads successfully and displays manual data upload options

steps.action: Navigate to the manual attendance data upload section
steps.expectedResult: Manual data upload interface is displayed with file upload controls and format instructions

steps.action: Click 'Browse' or 'Choose File' button and select the prepared sample manual attendance CSV file
steps.expectedResult: File selection dialog opens and selected file name is displayed in the upload interface

steps.action: Click 'Upload' or 'Import' button to initiate the manual attendance data ingestion
steps.expectedResult: File upload begins and progress indicator is displayed

steps.action: Wait for the system to process and ingest the uploaded CSV file
steps.expectedResult: System completes ingestion within 5 minutes and displays success message with number of records processed

steps.action: Verify that system normalizes the manual attendance records to match the standard database schema
steps.expectedResult: All manual attendance records are converted to standard format with consistent field names, date/time formats, and data types

steps.action: Query the attendance database to retrieve both biometric and manual attendance records for the same time period
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns combined results showing both biometric and manual attendance entries

steps.action: Verify that manual entries are merged with biometric data without creating duplicate records
steps.expectedResult: No duplicate attendance records exist for the same employee at the same timestamp; manual entries supplement biometric data appropriately

steps.action: Check that attendance records are accurate by comparing uploaded CSV data with database entries
steps.expectedResult: All fields match exactly including employee ID, date, time, attendance type, and any additional metadata

steps.action: Navigate to the admin monitoring interface for manual data ingestion
steps.expectedResult: Monitoring interface loads and displays recent ingestion activities

steps.action: Review the ingestion status for the recently uploaded CSV file
steps.expectedResult: Ingestion status shows successful completion with timestamp, file name, number of records processed, and any warnings or errors

steps.action: Verify that any errors or validation warnings are clearly displayed in the monitoring interface
steps.expectedResult: Errors and warnings are displayed with specific details including row numbers, field names, and error descriptions

postconditions: Manual attendance data is successfully stored in the database
Manual and biometric attendance data are merged without duplicates
Ingestion status is recorded in the monitoring interface
System is ready to accept additional manual data uploads

testCases.title: Verify conflict detection for duplicate entries
preconditions: Admin user has access to manual data upload interface
Test CSV file with intentional duplicate attendance records is prepared
Existing attendance data is present in the database for conflict testing
Admin monitoring interface is accessible
Conflict resolution workflow is configured in the system

steps.action: Log into the admin dashboard using valid administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Admin dashboard loads successfully

steps.action: Navigate to the manual attendance data upload section
steps.expectedResult: Manual data upload interface is displayed

steps.action: Select and upload the test CSV file containing duplicate attendance records (same employee, same date/time)
steps.expectedResult: File is uploaded and system begins processing

steps.action: Wait for system to complete validation and ingestion process
steps.expectedResult: System completes processing and displays summary of results including detected conflicts

steps.action: Verify that system identifies and flags duplicate records during ingestion
steps.expectedResult: System detects duplicate entries and flags them as conflicts without automatically overwriting existing data

steps.action: Check system logs for conflict detection entries
steps.expectedResult: System logs contain detailed conflict entries with employee ID, timestamp, conflicting values, and conflict type

steps.action: Navigate to the admin monitoring interface to view flagged conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Monitoring interface displays a conflicts section or tab with list of detected conflicts

steps.action: Review the conflict details displayed in the monitoring interface
steps.expectedResult: Each conflict is clearly identified with employee name/ID, date/time, existing value, new value, and conflict reason

steps.action: Verify that conflicts are presented in a user-friendly format for admin review
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are displayed in a table or list format with clear labels, color coding, and action options

steps.action: Select a flagged conflict and choose resolution option (e.g., keep existing, use new, or merge)
steps.expectedResult: Resolution options are available and selectable for each conflict

steps.action: Apply the selected resolution to resolve the conflict
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the resolution choice and updates the conflict status

steps.action: Trigger reprocessing of the resolved conflicts
steps.expectedResult: System reprocesses the data according to the resolution choices made

steps.action: Verify that attendance records are updated in the database according to the resolution
steps.expectedResult: Database records reflect the resolved conflicts with correct data based on admin's resolution choices

steps.action: Check that resolved conflicts are marked as completed in the monitoring interface
steps.expectedResult: Resolved conflicts show updated status with resolution timestamp and admin user who resolved them

postconditions: All duplicate conflicts are detected and logged
Conflicts are resolved according to admin decisions
Attendance database contains accurate, deduplicated records
Conflict resolution history is maintained in system logs
Monitoring interface reflects current conflict status

storyTitle: As Attendance System Administrator, I want to monitor data ingestion health to achieve reliable real-time attendance data

testCases.title: Validate ingestion health dashboard displays accurate status
preconditions: User is logged in as Attendance System Administrator
Ingestion health monitoring dashboard is accessible
Data ingestion system is operational
Test environment has capability to simulate ingestion scenarios
Alert notification system is configured and active

steps.action: Navigate to the ingestion health monitoring dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully and displays current ingestion status overview

steps.action: Simulate normal data ingestion by triggering a standard data feed from attendance sources
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows healthy status with green indicators, displays current metrics including ingestion rate, records processed, and last successful ingestion timestamp

steps.action: Verify all metrics on the dashboard are updating in real-time
steps.expectedResult: Metrics refresh automatically showing live data, ingestion count increments, and status remains healthy

steps.action: Simulate ingestion failure by stopping the data source or introducing a connection error
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard status changes to failure state with red indicators, error message is displayed, and failure timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Check for alert notification sent to administrators
steps.expectedResult: Alert is sent immediately via configured channels (email/SMS/in-app) with details of the ingestion failure including timestamp and error type

steps.action: Navigate to the logs section from the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Logs section opens displaying recent ingestion events

steps.action: Review logs for the simulated failure event
steps.expectedResult: Detailed logs are available showing failure timestamp, error description, affected data source, stack trace if applicable, and troubleshooting information

steps.action: Filter logs by failure events only
steps.expectedResult: Logs are filtered successfully showing only failure events with complete details for troubleshooting

steps.action: Restore normal data ingestion
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard status returns to healthy state, metrics resume normal updates, and recovery event is logged

postconditions: Dashboard accurately reflects current ingestion health status
All simulated events are logged in the system
Alert notifications were successfully delivered
Data ingestion is restored to normal operational state
Test data from simulation is cleaned up or marked as test data

storyTitle: As Attendance System Administrator, I want to handle data discrepancies to achieve accurate attendance aggregation

testCases.title: Validate detection of duplicate attendance records
preconditions: User is logged in as Attendance System Administrator
Attendance data processing system is operational
Discrepancy detection algorithms are enabled
Admin notification system is configured
Test attendance records are prepared for injection
Admin interface for discrepancy management is accessible

steps.action: Prepare duplicate attendance records with identical employee ID, date, and timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Test duplicate records are ready for injection with matching key fields

steps.action: Inject duplicate attendance records into the system through the data ingestion pipeline
steps.expectedResult: Records are successfully ingested into the system for processing

steps.action: Wait for the system to process the ingested records
steps.expectedResult: System completes processing and runs discrepancy detection algorithms

steps.action: Check the discrepancy detection system for flagged duplicates
steps.expectedResult: System automatically flags the duplicate records and marks them as discrepancies with duplicate type classification

steps.action: Verify that admin notification was sent
steps.expectedResult: Administrator receives notification via configured channels indicating duplicate records detected with count and affected employee IDs

steps.action: Navigate to the admin interface for discrepancy management
steps.expectedResult: Discrepancy management interface loads showing list of flagged discrepancies

steps.action: Admin reviews the flagged duplicate records in the interface
steps.expectedResult: Duplicates are clearly identified with side-by-side comparison showing matching fields, timestamp details, and source information for easy resolution

steps.action: Admin selects the duplicate records and chooses resolution action (keep one, merge, or delete)
steps.expectedResult: Resolution options are available and clearly presented with preview of outcome

steps.action: Admin resolves duplicates by selecting to keep the first record and remove the duplicate
steps.expectedResult: System processes the resolution request successfully

steps.action: Verify attendance data is updated after resolution
steps.expectedResult: Attendance data reflects the resolution with duplicate removed, only one valid record remains, and discrepancy status is cleared

steps.action: Check that the discrepancy no longer appears in the flagged items list
steps.expectedResult: Resolved discrepancy is removed from active discrepancies list and marked as resolved

postconditions: Duplicate attendance records are successfully detected and flagged
Administrator was notified of the discrepancy
Discrepancy is resolved and attendance data is accurate
Resolution action is recorded in the system
No duplicate records remain in active attendance data

testCases.title: Verify logging of discrepancy events
preconditions: User is logged in as Attendance System Administrator
Discrepancy detection system is operational
Logging system is enabled and configured
Test data is available to generate various discrepancy types
Log viewing interface is accessible to administrators

steps.action: Generate multiple discrepancy events by injecting duplicate records into the system
steps.expectedResult: Duplicate records are processed and flagged as discrepancies

steps.action: Generate conflicting timestamp discrepancy by injecting records with same employee but overlapping time periods
steps.expectedResult: Conflicting timestamp records are processed and flagged as discrepancies

steps.action: Generate anomaly discrepancy by injecting unusual attendance pattern (e.g., multiple check-ins without check-out)
steps.expectedResult: Anomaly records are processed and flagged as discrepancies

steps.action: Navigate to the discrepancy logs section in the admin interface
steps.expectedResult: Discrepancy logs interface loads successfully

steps.action: Review the logs for all generated discrepancy events
steps.expectedResult: All discrepancy events are logged with accurate timestamps, discrepancy type, affected employee IDs, record details, and detection time

steps.action: Verify each log entry contains complete information including event ID, timestamp, discrepancy type, affected records, and detection details
steps.expectedResult: Each log entry displays comprehensive information with all required fields populated accurately

steps.action: Filter logs by discrepancy type (duplicate)
steps.expectedResult: Logs are filtered successfully showing only duplicate discrepancy events

steps.action: Filter logs by date range covering the test period
steps.expectedResult: Logs are filtered to show only events within the specified date range

steps.action: Search logs by specific employee ID involved in discrepancies
steps.expectedResult: Logs are filtered to show only discrepancies related to the searched employee ID

steps.action: Export discrepancy logs for audit purposes
steps.expectedResult: Logs are exported successfully in a standard format (CSV/PDF) with complete and accurate discrepancy history

steps.action: Verify the exported file contains all log entries with timestamps and details
steps.expectedResult: Exported file contains complete and accurate discrepancy history matching the displayed logs

steps.action: Resolve one of the discrepancies and check if resolution is logged
steps.expectedResult: Resolution action is logged with timestamp, admin user who resolved it, resolution method, and outcome

postconditions: All discrepancy events are logged in the system
Logs contain complete and accurate information for audit purposes
Log filtering and search functionality is verified
Discrepancy history is available for compliance and troubleshooting
Resolution actions are tracked in the logs
